name: Introduction to Modernist Literature
description: This course introduces students to the main themes and works of modernist literature in the English language, primarily from the early twentieth century.

name: Modernism and Postmodernism in Literature
description: This course explores the key differences between modernism and postmodernism in literature, and how the two movements are connected.

name: Modernism and the Arts
description: This course examines the links between modernism and other art movements, such as cubism, surrealism, and abstract expressionism.

name: Modernism and Politics
description: This course examines the intersection between modernism and politics, discussing how modernist literature has been shaped by and shaped politics in the twentieth century.

name: Comparative Studies in Modernist Literature
description: This course encourages students to make connections between modernist literature from different countries and cultures.
